title: The twins who tricked the Maya gods of death - Ilan Stavans

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: A test of strength between the twins and the lords of the underworld.

options.label: D
options.text: A competition to see who could run the fastest.

options.label: D

options.text: The seers are not mentioned in the story.

options.label: C
options.text: They are confused and unsure of what to do.

options.label: D
options.text: They are killed and their powers are transferred to the twins.

options.label: A

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.text: They are forced to live in the underworld forever.

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: They are no longer able to terrorize humans.

title: 3 secrets of resilient people - Lucy Hone

multiple-choice.question: What is the main topic of the speaker's talk?

options.label: D
options.text: The American army's approach to mental health

options.label: B
options.text: She lost her 12-year-old daughter in a car accident

options.label: D
options.text: She was a victim of infidelity

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: Choosing to focus on the good things in life

options.label: C
options.text: Asking yourself if what you are doing is helping or harming you

options.label: D
options.text: She was skeptical of its effectiveness

title: The simplest math problem no one can solve

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the famous unsolved problem in mathematics that states every positive integer will eventually end up in a four, two, one loop?

options.label: B
options.text: Multiply by 3 and add 1 for odd numbers, and divide by 2 for even numbers

options.label: C
options.text: Multiply by 2 and subtract 1 for odd numbers, and divide by 2 for even numbers

options.label: D
options.text: Multiply by 3 and subtract 1 for odd numbers, and divide by 2 for even numbers

title: What few people know about the program that "saved" America - Meg Jacobs

multiple-choice.question: What was the main reason for the landslide victory of Franklin D. Roosevelt in the 1932 election?

options.label: A
options.text: His promise of a New Deal to support struggling citizens and put the country back to work.

options.label: B
options.text: His ability to address the economic crisis through his policies.

options.label: C
options.text: His opposition to the Republican Party.

multiple-choice.question: What was the first priority of the New Deal?

options.label: C
options.text: Providing relief to farmers and workers.

multiple-choice.question: What was the main goal of the Federal Emergency Relief Administration?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide employment to young men.

options.label: B
options.text: To provide relief to citizens who were struggling to afford basic necessities.

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of the New Deal on Black Americans?

options.label: A
options.text: They received a large share of jobs, vocational training, and education.

options.label: B
options.text: They faced significant barriers to accessing New Deal benefits.

options.label: C
options.text: They were not affected by the New Deal.

options.label: D
options.text: They received more benefits than white Americans.

multiple-choice.question: What was the legacy of the New Deal?

options.label: A
options.text: It empowered unions to challenge discriminatory hiring practices and laid the groundwork for an emerging civil rights coalition.

options.label: B
options.text: It led to a significant decrease in unemployment.

options.label: D
options.text: It had no impact on the economy.

multiple-choice.question: What was the main reason for the uneven impact of the New Deal on communities?

options.label: A
options.text: The New Deal's programs were not effective in addressing the economic crisis.

options.label: B
options.text: The New Deal's programs were not targeted towards the most vulnerable populations.

options.label: C
options.text: The New Deal's programs were not implemented effectively.

options.label: D
options.text: The New Deal's programs were implemented in a way that exacerbated existing inequalities.

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of the New Deal on unemployment?
What was the main goal of the Civilian Conservation Corps?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide relief to citizens who were struggling to afford basic necessities.

options.label: B
options.text: To provide employment to young men.

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of the New Deal on the economy?
What was the legacy of the New Deal in terms of civil rights?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to a significant decrease in discriminatory practices.

options.label: B
options.text: It empowered unions to challenge discriminatory hiring practices and laid the groundwork for an emerging civil rights coalition.

options.label: C
options.text: It had no impact on civil rights.

options.label: D
options.text: It led to an increase in discriminatory practices.
